item.title: You want to start to `pwn`?
item.description: So you want to start to pwn, don’t you? Well, I did too! Those are my notes on the past year of binary exploitation.

item.title: How to install Archlinux
item.description: I recently installed once again Archlinux on a laptop. Let me explain how to do so.

item.title: üì¶ HTB - Schooled
item.description: Cool box, not too CTF-like and real-life applicable, my first FreeBSD üòÑ But root part was too quick. TL;DR XSS to steal Moodle creds of teacher, privesc as manager and then RCE. Get MySQL in config file, dump users and get password hash. Break the hash with john to ssh as user. Common pkg install exploit for root. Footholds # Nmap 7.91 scan initiated Mon Aug 2 22:40:05 2021 as: nmap -A -p- -T4 -o nmap.

item.description: Maybe the most used tool when it comes to network discovery and port knocking.

item.title: üöÄ TL;DR - Docker
item.description: Wow you don’t know yet what Docker is? ü§î Let me introduce you this beautiful containerization tool!

item.title: üöÄ TL;DR - What is the 'TL;DR' series?
item.description: So I came up with this basic concept: TL;DR. But what is it exactly? The TL;DR series The main idea is to share some knowledge in a quick and concise way, such as a RUMP but written on a file. It is like a writeup speedrunning-ish style of writting. And maybe because I am kind of lazy sometimes. The goal here is to write small articles about a subject I like, a new technique learnt, or anything that is not worth a full and detailed article.

item.title: Free space on disk for Linux distros
item.description: Recently I wanted to run a MySQL Docker container and encountered a tragical error: simple_db | 2021-03-25 10:54:04+00:00 [Note] [Entrypoint]: Switching to dedicated user 'mysql' simple_db | 2021-03-25 10:54:04+00:00 [Note] [Entrypoint]: Entrypoint script for MySQL Server 5.7.31-1debian10 started. simple_db | 2021-03-25 10:54:04+00:00 [Note] [Entrypoint]: Initializing database files simple_db | 2021-03-25T10:54:04.578298Z 0 [Warning] TIMESTAMP with implicit DEFAULT value is deprecated. Please use --explicit_defaults_for_timestamp server option (see documentation for more details). simple_db | 2021-03-25T10:54:04.

item.title: üì¶ HTB - Ready
item.description: Cool box, maybe too easy for a medium? Got reverse shell in minutes, but stuck for root’s password for hours üòÖ TL;DR Gitlab RCE, get reverse shell. Privesc with cleartext root password, escape Docker to own the box. Footholds nmap Starting Nmap 7.80 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2021-03-14 16:00 UTC Nmap scan report for 10.10.10.220 Host is up (0.035s latency). Not shown: 998 closed ports PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 22/tcp open ssh OpenSSH 8.

item.title: SQLi lab solutions
item.description: Some weeks ago I created a trainning lab for SQL injections called SQLi lab. And I will go through all levels in this blog post, explainning the expected way to solve each of them. The lab currently contains 5 levels, and I will update this post as I add more of them üëç Installation The GitHub repository is at https://github.com/OxNinja/SQLi-lab if you want more information. First I clone the lab in a folder, add its IP to my hosts file for conveignance, and then build it with the given script:

item.title: üì¶ HTB - Magic
item.description: TL;DR HTTP redirect bypass (unintended üòÅ), PHP code execution through file upload to get a reverse shell. User with hardcoded SQL credentials on server, privesc with custom binary with no $PATH check. As I am an idiot, I reinstalled my distribution without making a backup of my files üôà So I don’t have any screenshot or payloads I used for this box to show you Footholds With a basic nmap we found only two ports: 22 and 80.

item.title: üì¶ HTB - Obscurity
item.description: Obscurity is my first medium box so I was very happy when I got that root.txt :D TL;DR Custom Python web server, get source code, get revserse shell, crack user password for custom encryption system, use john to privesc. Footholds To make things easier, I added the box to my /etc/hosts. Recon Let’s start with nmap to discover the open ports : > nmap -A obscurity.htb -o nmap.out Nmap scan report for obscurity.

item.title: Setup your database with Docker
item.description: Yeah, I wanted to do one of those for a long time üòÅ So, we have to stay at home for the moment, I decided to make a “walkthrough” about something I used sometimes and I couldn’t remember all the commands. So, let’s build our MySQL database within a Docker container üê≥ ! Get the Docker image I will be using the mysql image from the Docker hub. 1 docker pull mysql Run the container For further details, you can read the official documentation for the image on Docker hub.

item.title: La vuln√©rabilit√© Shellshock
item.description: Shellshock est une vuln√©rabilit√© pr√©sente dans bash 4.3 et ant√©rieur. Il s’agit d’une vuln√©rabilit√© logicielle qui se base sur de l’injection de commande en passant par les variables d’environement. C’est vachement cool car elle m√®ne √† une bonne grosse RCE des familles, donc c’est pas n√©gligeable üòò. Statistiques Quelques statistiques afin d’illustrer la port√©e et l’attention port√©e de la vuln√©rabilit√©. Shellshock a beaucoup √©t√© √† la mode quand elle est sortie, √©norm√©ment de trafic a √©t√© g√©n√©r√© par des botnets lors de tentatives d’exploitation de la vuln√©rabilit√©.

item.title: Les pyjails pour les d√©butants
item.description: Introduction Tout d’abord qu’est-ce qu’une ‘pyjail’ ? Il s’agit le plus souvent d’un environnement Python üêç restreint, c’est-√†-dire que (comme pour les autres types de ‘jails’) certaines fonctions, classes ont √©t√© supprim√©es, ou sont filtr√©es lors du traitement de l’input utilisateur pour bloquer l’attaquant. Ces environnements restreints sont pr√©sents lors de CTFs mais c’est une cat√©gorie qui n√©cessite un peu de connaissances avant de s’y lancer, mais sont aussi utilis√©s dans des milieux professionnels afin d’√©viter de donner l’acc√®s √† tout le syst√®me si un attaquant arrive √† entrer sur un serveur SSH par exemple.

item.title: About
item.description: French ingeneering student in cybersecurity, I like the web, reverse and assembly. I participate in CTFs with my team FakeNews. I mostly do the web challenge because this is the easiest when you begin in cybersecurity. üòá CTF InterIUT 2020 staff üèÅ Norzh CTF 2021 staff üß≠ Why this website The first need of this blog was to help me to remind things as I learn them, and this is a great chance to share my knowledges with others!

item.title: Projects
item.description: I made some projects, some are very interesting, and some are more for learning purposes or testing. I listed here the ones I am the more proud of, but you can get a more exhaustive list by looking here: https://github.com/OxNinja https://git.fakenews.sh CTF Kit A CLI tool to automate CTF deployment. Focus on the challenges üö© SQLi lab A cybersecurity playground to test your üíâ SQL injection skills!
